vactypedosesÂ¶

vizcovidfr.line_charts.line_charts.vactypedoses(vaccine_type='All vaccines', color_pal='darkblue', color_pal2='crimson', color_pal3='darkgreen', font_size=16, font_family='Franklin Gothic Medium', font_color='white', bgcolor='darkslategrey', template='plotly_dark')Â¶

Make an interactive line chart of France vaccine data.

Parameters

  • vaccine_type (str, optional, default='All vaccines') â€“ the vaccine type we want to display. Either â€˜Pfizerâ€™, â€˜Modernaâ€™, â€˜AstraZenecaâ€™ or â€˜All vaccinesâ€™. In this latter case, the three vaccine types are represented. It is possible to hover oneâ€™s mouse over the curves to get thorough information.

  • color_pal (str, optional, default='darkblue') â€“

    the color of the chosen vaccine type curve. If â€˜All vaccinesâ€™ vaccine_type is chosen, set the color of the â€˜Pfizerâ€™ curve.

    For reference, see http://www.python-simple.com/img/img45.png.

  • color_pal2 (str, optional, default='crimson') â€“

    Only if â€˜All vaccinesâ€™ vaccine_type is chosen. Set the color of â€˜Modernaâ€™ curve.

    For reference, see http://www.python-simple.com/img/img45.png.

  • color_pal3 (str, optional, default='darkgreen' :param font_size: the size of characters in hover labels) â€“

    Only if â€˜All vaccinesâ€™ vaccine_type is chosen. Set the color of â€˜AstraZenecaâ€™ curve.

    For reference, see http://www.python-simple.com/img/img45.png.

  • font_family (str, optional, default='Franklin Gothic Medium') â€“

    the font family of the characters in hover labels.

    For reference, see http://jonathansoma.com/site/lede/data-studio/matplotlib/list-all-fonts-available-in-matplotlib-plus-samples/

  • font_color (str, optional, default='white') â€“ the color of characters in hover labels, For reference, see http://www.python-simple.com/img/img45.png.

  • bgcolor (str, optional, default='darkslategrey') â€“ the background color of all hover labels on graph. For reference, see http://www.python-simple.com/img/img45.png.

  • template (str, optional, default='plotly_dark') â€“

    the visual style we want the graph to be based on.

    For reference, see https://plotly.com/python/templates/.

Returns

animated line chart representing the actual dose number of the chosen vaccine type (in storage).

Return type

plotly.graph_objects.Figure

vacdosesÂ¶

vizcovidfr.line_charts.line_charts.vacdoses(unit='doses', font_size=16, font_family='Franklin Gothic Medium', font_color='white', bgcolor='darkslategrey', template='plotly_dark')Â¶

Make an interactive line chart of France vaccine data.

Parameters

  • unit (str, optional, default='doses') â€“

    the type of dose units we want to display. Either â€˜dosesâ€™ or â€˜cduâ€™ (shorts for â€˜common dispensing unitsâ€™),

    • â€™dosesâ€™:

      display the evolution of total vaccine doses in storage, from January 2021 until now. (checkouts are not made everyday).

    • â€™cduâ€™:

      display the evolution of total vaccine bottles in storage, from January 2021 until now. (checkouts are not made everyday).

    For â€˜Pfizerâ€™ vaccine, the cdu conversion rate per dose is multiplied by 6. For Moderna and AstraZeneca vaccines, the cdu conversion rate per dose is multiplied by 10.

  • font_size (int, optional, default=16) â€“ the size of characters in hover labels.

  • font_family (str, optional, default='Franklin Gothic Medium') â€“ the font family of the characters in hover labels. For reference, see http://jonathansoma.com/site/lede/data-studio/matplotlib/list-all-fonts-available-in-matplotlib-plus-samples/.

  • font_color (str, optional, default='white') â€“ the color of characters in hover labels. For reference, see http://www.python-simple.com/img/img45.png.

  • bgcolor (str, optional, default='darkslategrey') â€“

    the background color of all hover labels on graph.

    For reference, see http://www.python-simple.com/img/img45.png.

  • template (str, optional, default='plotly_dark') â€“

    the visual style we want the graph to be based on.

    For reference, see https://plotly.com/python/templates/.

Returns

An interactive line chart representing the actual amount in storage of vaccine doses, according to the chosen unit.

Return type

plotly.graph_objects.Figure
